story: Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was so excited, because it was her birthday! She was very excited, and ran around with joy.\\n\\nBut when the night came, it was very dark and cold. Lucy was scared, she wanted her house to be warm and dry. Luckily, the next day, her walls were warm and cozy, it wasn't long until it was time for sleep. As the dark went on, Lucy started to hear a strange sound. She looked around her room, trying to guess where the sound came from.\\n\\nSuddenly, Lucy saw a tiny mouse in the corner. It was so small and quiet. She was a little less scared, but she still didn't know why the mouse was there, so she asked it. The mouse explained to her that its name was Murph. Then, Lucy decided it was time to go to sleep.\\n\\nShe snuggled up in her bed, hugged her teddy and fell asleep. In the morning, when she woke up, all of her things were still there! Lucy was so happy that she had solved the mystery of her first night in an emergency.\\n
assessment: The student's story is generally well-written and grammatically correct. It contains a dialogue between Lucy and the mouse, named Murph. story: Once there was a tall boy and she liked to joke. She thought it was fun to make silly faces. One day, she wanted to make a joke even more. She found some gum and thought to tell it to the other children. They all knew it was stupid to joke around.\\n\\nThe boy was very clever and the other children started to laugh. They told her it was the funniest joke. They all wanted to joke around and have fun. They asked the tall boy to tell it again.\\n\\nFinally, the tall boy told the joke. All the children laughed and cheered. The tall boy smiled and the gum still stuck to her lips! The kids had a lot of fun with the joke and their new friend. They laughed and joked for a long time.\\n
